text: Low-sodium diets can reduce blood pressure in hypertensive patients. Recommended foods include leafy greens, berries, and whole grains. Avoid dairy if allergic.
For diabetic patients, low-glycemic foods like quinoa, legumes, and non-starchy vegetables are beneficial. Avoid nuts if allergic.
Potassium-rich foods like bananas and spinach can help manage high blood pressure. Ensure dairy-free options for allergic patients.
Diabetic patients should focus on high151-fiber foods like oats and avoid high-sugar dairy products if allergic.
Hypertensive patients benefit from DASH diet foods like fruits, vegetables, and lean proteins. Nut-free options include seeds and legumes for allergies.
Diabetes management includes complex carbohydrates like whole grains andPo avoiding dairy-based desserts for lactose intolerance or allergies.
